ABOUT US Orphanage Without Borders is a volunteer organization aiming to create an impact in the life of children. Our purpose is to facilitate connections between orphanages and projects helping children in order to respond to their needs. We intend to use the existing resources and the power of organizations that already exist to help in specific areas. We believe that collaboration is the key to improve the life of depracated children and that the knowledge of existing resources is an enourmous asset to make help more efficient.
DESCRIPTION Abandoned children are a vulnerable population who experience a difficult life. The population includes orphan children living in the streets as well as children hosted in orphanages because either they do not have a family or their families are unable to provide them care due to extreme poverty or other reasons. The number of abandoned children is increasing worldwide especially in countries striked by poverty, conflicts, diseases and disasters where the mortality increases as well as their chances of becoming orphans.
Poverty is the main reason of having a high number of the children in orphanages. Most of the children in orphanages have not lost their parents but their families do not afford to raise them. For example, many children born during Ceausescu’s anti-abortion law were placed in orphanages. According to the Save the Children reports, an average of 80% of the children in orphanages are put in orphanages due to poverty. In Ghana, Indonesia and countries in eastern Europe this percentage is even higher: 90%.
Countries involved in war also have a high number of orphans such as Afghanistan that has one and half million orphans. Based on Unicef report, “During the last decade, 2 million children worldwide have been killed as a result of war, four to five million children have been disabled, 12 million have been left homeless, more than one million orphaned or separated from their parents, and approximately ten million children have been psychologically traumatized as a result of war (UNICEF's The State of World's Children 1996)”.
Epidemic diseases such as HIV are another reason for the increased number of orphans who in addition are likely to host these diseases. For instance, South Africa, with the rate of 70,000 a year, has the highest number of orphans with HIV whose parents have died due to AIDS (Time World June 01 2011). In addition, disease outbreaks that happen in war countries are difficult to eradicate. For example, polio re-emerged in 2005 in Angola after the civil war and vaccination campaigns were difficult (especially in the countryside) to pursue when the infrastructures were destroyed.
Finally, natural or human made disasters increase the number of orphans. For instance, in Japan and Haiti, a huge number of children lost their parents due to earthquakes. It is estimated that 1400 children lost at least one parent, around 200 children lost both earthquake in Japan (Time World July, 10 2011.) and U.S. adopteted 1000 children from Haiti. The effects of natural disasters are commonly stronger in poor countries and increase the chances of diseases.
OUR DREAM We envision to certify that projects in our network work toward providing children the quality of life. It is important for the children to reach a minimum standard in each area in order to allow them to grow and build their future as deserve by any human being. We provide support in the areas of health, education, food, shelter, clothing, hygiene, joy, hope of future, love, responsibilities, safety, guidance, compassionate atmosphere and discipline. Projects of the OWB network engage to follow the standards of these areas as follow:
Health: It provides medical care when children suffer of disease or get hurt. It also teach the children the importance of a healthy diet and physical exercise. For instance, physical exercise should be encouraged and frequently practiced allowing children to develop their favorite sport in the limits of availability.
Education: It encourages children to go to the school and provides guidance with homework and questions about intellectual, emotional or any other doubt during their childhood. As most of the parents would do for their children, it should aim to help them so they have good scores and over all learn the basic knowledge to survive in their society.
Food: It provides three healthy meals a day or at least the average nutrients and food of the population in its country. Variety and international menus are encourage even though we understand that most of the times the situation is not easy.
Shelter: It hosts the children inside a protected shelter. Likely, the place would be a safe building but in emergency situations such a disasters or extreme poverty the place could be more temporary homes protecting the children. The place should contain different areas for playing, doing homework, cooking and sleeping. These areas should have the minimum material and space to perform the associated task. For example, the bedroom should contain mattresses or any other furniture appropriate to the country providing a good rest to the children.
Clothing: It provides cloths to the children for daily life, school and special occasions. It is responsible of changing their cloths and/or shoes at least once a week and keeping them clean. It also teach the children how to take care of their own cloths and look.
Hygiene: It has a bathroom with shower, sink and toilet that must be clean at any time. It also has a place to clean cloths. It is essential that all areas are clean including mattresses, rooms and kitchen. As an educational exercise it should encourage children to participate in daily cleaning tasks. This mustn’t me done as a way to reduce expenses for cleaning purposes but as good parents do with their own children to teach them the sense of responsibility and community
Joy: It reserves time for the children to play alone and in group. It encourages social games and good relationship between children to increase the sense of family. The games should happen in an safe environment with the surveillance of an appropriate number of adults which are encouraged to participate and cheer them. The games should be adapted in order to make all children participating independently of personal issues such diseases or handicaps.
Hope of future: It encourages the children to envision their future and professions. It helps them providing the education and guidance to allow them achieve their dreams. It also has a plan for all the children independently of their dreams for after their childhood. All children must have a way out of thieving, begging or being completely abandoned when they become adults.
Love: Its staff or external adults should provide the sense of care as a parent would do with their own children. The children should feel every day that they can count on someone that spend part of their time with them. It provides the love to overcome the impact of not having their parents close and a reference for them to be able to love others. It should supply staff or external people and should train care givers to overcome the extensive work of the shelter in order to provide enough love to the children.
Responsibilities: It should make the children involved with the daily tasks as a way of teaching the sense of responsibility and social obligations. These tasks are intended to make the children feel part of a big family by being willing to improve their conditions and the place. Responsibilities include cleaning and taking care of their younger sister and brothers.
Safety: It should guaranty that all activities happen in a safe environment exempt of accidents, fights, abuse any bulling. Safety include conducts between children and with respect to the staff and outsider volunteers. It should avoid dangerous situations like cutting objects or neglected places or situations and provide a plan for caring of the children in case of accidents. It must be like a refuge to children from the outside world. Any discrimination, sexual and physical abuse of any kind must not be tolerated.
Guidance: It should provide a mentor or people that can advice the children while they are growing. These people should pay close attention to how they conduct, encouraging them to do the right things by being an example. These people could be staff or outside volunteers. All the conditions of health, safety, responsibilities, shelter, food, hygiene, joy, compassionate environment, guidance and discipline also apply to the staff and volunteers.
Compassionate environment: It should build a compassionate environment between the children and with respect to the staff and volunteers. In addition, helping others is an important teaching from life since it helps to overcome our egos. This is part of many religion and society rules. Children must participate in outside volunteer opportunities and have a volunteering project that will reinforce the community feeling part of their own big family.
Discipline: Discipline is a required part for a human to live in any society. Rules must be clear and oriented according to the standards. Children should have guidance during play and education moments. They must have an external authority that make them follow the rules without any abuse or hard authority. We assume that it is the responsibility of the care takers that all these points are follow. Of course, it could happen that the children do not contribute or feel enthusiastic about their responsibilities in particular when there is a long history of bad habits.
OUR VIEW Our ultimate goal is to being able to provide the minimum standards for each of the different areas for orphans and abandoned children all around the world. For this purpose, we believe that we have also responsibilities toward orphanages, donors, organizations and volunteers participating to this ambitious project. Therefore, it is also part of our goals building a good relationship within these four partners, make communication clear and develop common respect. Our goals include the need to provide this environment in order to empower our efforts toward helping the conditions of children.
Union: Many efforts exist around the world providing good support in different areas. We engage to coordinate these efforts and provide an infrastructure allowing these different organizations close collaboration. We will also provide a common gate for organizations and individuals willing to help the cause.
Recycle Efforts: We are responsible of using the current efforts for helping orphan and abandoned children to reach resources including funding, volunteers and training. We do not intend to create a new organization helping directly to the cause but helping to bring forward the work of those organizations that are already involved directly with the orphanages or other activities helping children. We engage to empower their efforts.
Clear Communication: We are responsible of surveying the projects and facilitating the communication between the organizations and individuals through our network contributing to helping children. Information about the status and needs of the projects will be frequent and clear. This will guaranty that the standards of each project are follow and people know at any time the status of their investments. Also, our infrastructure will facilitate the people providing resources such as money or time to decide in what specific project and activity they want to help. For example, donors should be able to decide to the detail of funding to a health activity such as buying new drugs for an orphanage.
Learning from Experience: We aim to create an infrastructure allowing projects to learn from previous and current projects. Therefore, non-confidential information have to be available and organized to increase the efficiency of the projects. We engage to provide tools to the collaborators of each project in order to share information and avoiding repeating the same efforts.
Facilitate Help: We engage to build an infrastructure were people can easily provide their help. This will be perform by taking advantage of the current technological advances and bringing them to the organizations, individuals and orphanages. In addition, we will facilitate volunteer opportunities with a minimum expenses.
Community Involvement: This experience should be not only a way to improve the quality of life of orphan children but also an example to all involved people as donors, volunteers and staff. We can learn the basic and good principles by focusing on children that have much to teach us and paying attention to the important needs of a human being. We engage to involve the children in project and to provide feedback of their opinions and feelings to the community.
General Involvement: We aim to involve as many people as possible to help to the cause. For this purpose, it is also part of our involvement to bring the problem of orphan and abandoned children needs to the community. We engage to broadcast the need for helping these children and provide tasks to the community helping for the cause and adapted to each group we are trying to reach to such as schools. Thus, outreach is part of our goals.
Contributor Recognition: Social recognition is an important source of motivation for contributors. We will provide an infrastructure that will facilitate social network recognition and awards to volunteers, donors, organizations and orphanages for their contribution or their good work and participation.
OUR WAY Orphanage Without Borders provides a common portal for organization and individuals to unify their efforts and facilitate contributions to the cause of abandoned children. This site allows projects of our network to inform about the specific needs for reaching the acceptable standards of child's lifes. They are also able to create the necessary projects that will walk them through the path to follow the standards. Through our portal, individuals and organizations know about child's needs, projects and their status. This information is critical for participants that are able to decide in detail how their contribution is used and know how their volunteer actions will make a difference. It is also important for nonprofits willing to help to the cause in their specific area. Therefore, our portal creates a network connecting orphanages with organizations, individuals and nonprofits with different expertise. A collaborative environment results in a more efficient support and increases the confidence of people participating to the cause. In addition, we hope our portal will be a site to share knowledge that allows new projects to learn from previous experience. Moreover, it will be a practical source of information for volunteers and organizations. We intend to use the resources in each area provided by existing organizations to support existing projects. Our organization provides the technoligical tools, consultancy and expertise to support activities toward these goals in each of these areas. Our portalis a visual development solution for organizations and projects to increase contributions from individuals and support improving the standards of life of children around the world by addressing the current issues:
Joining efforts and resources to take advantage of previous experiences
Motivating collaboration against competition
Informing more contributors about the status of the projects
Allowing contributors to make decision on how their help is used
Rewarding contributors to motivate more collaboration
Creating a strong network of resources working together on the common objective of improving the life quality of orphaned and abandoned children.
Creating a network of volunteers, motivate people to participate in the program and facilitate their experience
Improving the relationship and links between donors, non-profit organizations and volunteers.
Increasing the help to orphaned and abandoned children
Increasing the flow of information about the cause
Visually representing the status and the resources for everyone who wants to change the situation.
HOW TO HELP There are different ways to get involved with the cause:
You are an organization devoted to help improving the standards of one or more of the areas we defined of children's life. Join our network as an organization" and add your organization to the network for sharing your ideas and projects as well as learning from other organizations.
You are an orphanage, a group or an individual that you daily interact with abandoned or orphaned children trying to improve their lifes. By joining our network you can share the needs you have with organizations and individuals that can contribute by creating projects to respond to your needs or supporting your efforts.
You are an individual that want to make a difference in children's life and help the existing efforts either financially or by volunteering. You can search the current opportunities and needs around the world by navigating to our map view and looking for the needs and projects helping the cause.
You want to know more about the situation of the cause, the current needs and raise awareness. You can be informed on a daily news of the situation, search for specific information, meet people that are involved in the cause and share your ideas and the information about the cause in social medias.
You want to be directly involved and develop further our project trying to facilitate collaboration between organizations and individuals involved in the cause of helping orphans and abandoned children. You can join our research team in charge of hunting organizations that are part of the cause or organizations that may be able to help the cause by providing help in a specific area. We also identify groups of children around the world that need help and do not had the opportunity yet of being in touch with the right people. Please, drop us an email and tell us what is your interest and how you would like to help.
You are a programmer or a graphical designer willing to help improving our tool facilitating the collaboration. You may want to improve our front end or the design of our front end. Our code is an open source because we think that collaboration goes beyond this cause. In fact, we hope that other causes benefit of this project to accelerate help in other fields. Our source is at https://github.com/mcharcos/owb.git. Follow our project and let us know if you feel like contributing in some way.
